filmography.title: The Man in Grey
filmography.role_description: A cruel and cynical 18th-century aristocrat who marries for an heir but despises his wife, establishing Mason as a popular anti-hero.
filmography.plot: A brutal lord marries a wealthy woman for her money, but his cruelty drives her into the arms of another man.

filmography.title: The Seventh Veil
filmography.role_description: A crippled, domineering guardian who demands absolute perfection from his world-class pianist ward.
filmography.plot: A suicidal concert pianist undergoes hypnosis to uncover the trauma caused by her cruel guardian.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Original Screenplay (Muriel & Sydney Box)

filmography.title: The Wicked Lady
filmography.role_description: A dashing highwayman who becomes the lover and partner-in-crime of a bored, thrill-seeking noblewoman.
filmography.plot: A bored aristocrat begins a secret life of crime as a highway robber, partnering with a notorious bandit.

filmography.title: Odd Man Out
filmography.role_description: A wounded Irish revolutionary leader who wanders the snowy streets of Belfast, delirious and hunted by the police.
filmography.plot: Following a botched robbery, a wounded Irish nationalist leader is abandoned by his gang and left to wander the city while evading the police.

filmography.title: Caught
filmography.role_description: A dedicated pediatrician who offers a young woman a chance at real love and escape from her abusive, wealthy husband.
filmography.plot: A young woman marries a wealthy tycoon, but his psychotic control forces her to flee into the arms of a humble doctor.

filmography.title: The Reckless Moment
filmography.role_description: A sympathetic Irish criminal who blackmails a housewife to protect her daughter but ends up falling in love with her.
filmography.plot: A mother tries to cover up a murder she thinks her daughter committed, but she is blackmailed by a criminal with a conscience.

filmography.title: Madame Bovary
filmography.role_description: The author himself, who appears in the framing device defending his novel and its heroine in a French court of law.
filmography.plot: The story of Emma Bovary, a romantic but unhappily married woman who engages in adulterous affairs to escape her mundane life.

filmography.title: Pandora and the Flying Dutchman
filmography.role_description: A mysterious, immortal sea captain condemned to sail the oceans forever until he finds a woman willing to die for him.
filmography.plot: A beautiful woman in 1930s Spain becomes fascinated by a mysterious yachtsman who is actually the legendary Flying Dutchman.

filmography.title: The Desert Fox: The Story of Rommel
filmography.role_description: The celebrated German general who grows disillusioned with Hitler's leadership and becomes involved in the plot to assassinate him.
filmography.plot: The story of the final years of Erwin Rommel, focusing on his military campaigns and his conflict with the Nazi regime.
filmography.awards: National Board of Review: Top Ten Films

filmography.title: 5 Fingers
filmography.role_description: An ambitious valet to the British Ambassador in Turkey who sells Allied secrets to the Nazis to fund his retirement.
filmography.plot: A valet sells secrets to the Germans during WWII, not out of ideology, but to realize his dream of becoming a gentleman.

filmography.title: The Prisoner of Zenda
filmography.role_description: A dashing, villainous henchman who aids in a plot to steal the throne, engaging in a memorable sword fight finale.
filmography.plot: An Englishman who looks exactly like the King of Ruritania must impersonate the monarch when he is kidnapped by his ambitious half-brother.

filmography.title: Julius Caesar
filmography.role_description: The noble Roman senator who is manipulated by Cassius into assassinating his friend Caesar for the good of the Republic.
filmography.plot: The growing ambition of Julius Caesar leads a group of Roman senators to plot his assassination.
filmography.awards: National Board of Review: Win – Best Actor

filmography.title: The Man Between
filmography.role_description: A cynical black marketeer in post-war Berlin who risks his life to help a British woman escape the Eastern sector.
filmography.plot: A British woman visiting Berlin gets caught up in a spy ring and falls for a mysterious intermediary operating between East and West.

filmography.title: A Star Is Born
filmography.role_description: A fading, alcoholic movie star who discovers and mentors a young singer, tragically watching her rise as he falls.
filmography.plot: A movie star helps a young singer and actress find fame, even as age and alcoholism send his own career into a downward spiral.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Actor; Golden Globe: Win – Best Actor (Comedy/Musical)

filmography.title: 20,000 Leagues Under the Sea
filmography.role_description: The brilliant, fanatical, and tragic anti-hero who commands the submarine Nautilus, waging war against humanity's warmongers.
filmography.plot: A ship sent to investigate a wave of mysterious sinkings encounters the advanced submarine Nautilus, commanded by the mysterious Captain Nemo.

filmography.title: Bigger Than Life
filmography.role_description: A mild-mannered schoolteacher who develops psychotic delusions of grandeur after becoming addicted to cortisone.
filmography.plot: A schoolteacher and family man suffers a psychotic break and threatens his family after becoming addicted to a new miracle drug.

filmography.title: North by Northwest
filmography.role_description: A suave, sophisticated, and ruthless foreign spy who mistakes an advertising executive for a government agent.
filmography.plot: A New York City advertising executive goes on the run after being mistaken for a government agent by a group of foreign spies.

filmography.title: Journey to the Center of the Earth
filmography.role_description: A determined Edinburgh professor who leads an expedition deep into the Earth's core to follow the path of an ancient explorer.
filmography.plot: An Edinburgh professor and assorted colleagues follow an explorer's trail down an extinct Icelandic volcano to the earth's center.

filmography.title: Lolita
filmography.role_description: A middle-aged European professor who becomes obsessed with the 14-year-old daughter of his landlady.
filmography.plot: A middle-aged college professor becomes infatuated with a fourteen-year-old nymphet.

filmography.title: The Fall of the Roman Empire
filmography.role_description: A Greek philosopher and advisor to Emperor Marcus Aurelius who dreams of a peaceful unification of Rome's peoples.
filmography.plot: The death of Marcus Aurelius leads to a succession crisis between his corrupt son Commodus and his loyal general Livius.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Win – Best Original Score

filmography.title: Georgy Girl
filmography.role_description: A wealthy, older businessman who proposes a mistress arrangement to the young, unconventional daughter of his butler.
filmography.plot: A misfit fights for happiness in the world of swinging London.

filmography.title: The Deadly Affair
filmography.role_description: A British intelligence officer who investigates the suicide of a government official, uncovering a spy ring closer to home than he expected.
filmography.plot: A British agent investigates the apparent suicide of a Foreign Office official and uncovers a web of betrayal.

filmography.title: Cross of Iron
filmography.role_description: A weary, pragmatic German colonel on the Russian front who tries to manage the conflict between a heroic sergeant and an arrogant captain.
filmography.plot: A squad of German soldiers fight for survival on the Eastern Front in 1943, led by a war-weary sergeant.

filmography.title: Heaven Can Wait
filmography.role_description: A heavenly bureaucrat who tries to rectify a mistake when a pro quarterback is taken to the afterlife prematurely.
filmography.plot: A Los Angeles Rams quarterback, accidentally taken away from his body by an overanxious angel before he was meant to die, returns to life in the body of a recently murdered millionaire.
filmography.awards: Saturn Award: Nomination – Best Supporting Actor

filmography.title: Murder by Decree
filmography.role_description: A loyal, intelligent, and capable Dr. Watson who aids Sherlock Holmes in hunting down Jack the Ripper.
filmography.plot: Sherlock Holmes and Dr. Watson hunt for Jack the Ripper, uncovering a conspiracy that leads to the highest levels of the British government.
filmography.awards: Genie Award: Win – Best Supporting Actor

filmography.title: The Verdict
filmography.role_description: A powerful, highly paid, and unscrupulous defense attorney who uses every legal trick to defeat a washed-up lawyer in a medical malpractice suit.
filmography.plot: A lawyer sees the chance to salvage his career and self-respect by taking a medical malpractice case to trial rather than settling.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Supporting Actor; Golden Globe: Nomination – Best Supporting Actor

filmography.title: The Shooting Party
filmography.role_description: An aristocratic landowner hosting a shooting party on his estate on the eve of World War I, representing the end of an era; Mason's final film.
filmography.plot: In 1913, an English aristocrat hosts a shooting party at his estate, where social tensions and personal rivalries foreshadow the coming war.
